it.emarolab.scene_identification_tagging.sceneRepresentation

Class SceneRepresentation

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.emarolab.scene_identification_tagging.sceneRepresentation.SceneRepresentation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SITBase

    public class SceneRepresentation
extends java.lang.Object
implements SITBase
    The core of this system than compute the SIT algorithm.

    This class is in charge to map the SpatialRelation between two objects in a set of relations to an abstract scene representation. It also compute the recognition with a given confidence. Last but not the least, it is able to learn(String) the actual concrete scene by using it as a template and create a new semantic abstract representation (stored in the ontology) that can be used for further recognition. Note that those are asserted to by sub classes of CLASS#SCENE and the reasoner is in charge (though instance checking) to create a hierarchy between scenes that share some similarities.
    During constructor it computes the SIT algorithm for the recognition phase, by create a set of SpatialRelation (getRelations()) applied to an abstract INDIVIDUAL#SCENE, appended with a static counter (* An optional flag for adding the time stamp data property (i.e.: DATA_PROPERTY#TIME) is also available.). This is the minimal set of the relation that represents the scene, to obtained the relations in more human friendly way you need to use SpatialSimplifier.populateHumanFriendlyRelationSet(), and eventually SpatialSimplifier.readObjectSemantics(boolean).
    Eventually you may want to use shouldLearn() and learn(String) to create a new ontological class that can be used for further recognise the presented composition of objects. This sets also the getRecognitionConfidence() and the related getBestRecognitionDescriptor(). The confidence is compute as C/I where, C is the best (i.e.: higher) cardinality of the class describing the scene, while I is the cardinality of the individual describing the scene. This is a number always within [0,1].
    The spatial relation between a Scene and two objects are obtained by adding the OBJECT_PROPERTY#PREFIX_HAS to the spatial object property given between two individuals.

    File: it.emarolab.scene_identification_tagging.sceneRepresentation.SceneRepresentation

    date: 05/06/17

    • Constructor Detail

      • SceneRepresentation

        public SceneRepresentation(SpatialSimplifier objects,
                           it.emarolab.amor.owlInterface.OWLReferences ontoRef)
        This constructor assume that the given object have all object property that describes spatial relations between two objects (already populated from SWRL rules) in the minimal form. With that it computes the recognition of the scene by adding the abstract scene representation (i.e.: individual) to the ontology.
        Parameters:
        objects - the objects describing spatial relations.
        ontoRef - the ontology that the SIT should manipulate.

    • Method Detail

      • learn

        public void learn(java.lang.String newSceneName)
        It uses the getSceneDescriptor() as a template to create a new abstract scene class the perfectly fits its recognition (i.e.: {@link #getRecognitionConfidence()} = 1). This method calls the reasoning task to place the new scene in the CLASS#SCENE hierarchy and updates the getRecognitionConfidence() and getSceneDescriptor().
        Parameters:
        newSceneName - the name of the new scene representation to learn

      • shouldLearn

        public boolean shouldLearn()
        Return true if the scene has been not clarified or if the getRecognitionConfidence() is lower than SITBase.CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD. The latter, indicates that only a small part of the spatial relations in the scene has been recognised. Otherwise it returns false.
        Returns:
        It indicate if the recognition went well.

      • getRelations

        public java.util.Set<SpatialRelation> getRelations()
        The minimal set of spatial relation properties between oll the individuals given on the constructor.
        Returns:
        the spatial relations between objects

      • getSceneDescriptor

        public SceneIndividualDescriptor getSceneDescriptor()
        The concrete scene description created on the constructor.
        Returns:
        an OWLOOP description for the individual describing the concrete scene.

      • getBestRecognitionDescriptor

        public SceneClassDescriptor getBestRecognitionDescriptor()
        The abstract scene class that best fits the recognition of this concrete scene individual. Other classes that describe more generically this scene can be obtained from the super classes of this Descriptor.
        Returns:
        the class that best recognises the scene.

      • getRecognitionConfidence

        public double getRecognitionConfidence()
        The value of the confidences computed as the best recognition cardinality over the scene individual cardinality. This values is always within [0,1] where 0 means not recognised and 1 perfectly recognised.
        Returns:
        the recognition confidence.

      • isAddingTime

        public boolean isAddingTime()
        Return if this class add (or not) a time stamp data property to the concrete scene individual (i.e.: DATA_PROPERTY#TIME)
        Returns:
        true if the time stamp is introduced in the ontology. false otherwise

      • setAddingTime

        public void setAddingTime(boolean addTime)
        Enable/disable the adding of a time stamp data property to the concrete scene individual (i.e.: DATA_PROPERTY#TIME)
        Parameters:
        addTime - true enable time stamping, false disable it.
